title: Red Tractor ad banned for misleading environmental claims
summary:

title: Amazon shares a ‘first look’ at new nuclear facility
summary:
Amazon shared some new details about its plans to help deploy more nuclear energy across Washington State, where the company is headquartered.
A rendering of the Cascade Advanced Energy Facility.
A rendering of the Cascade Advanced Energy Facility.
Called the Cascade Advanced Energy Facility, it’ll include three sections with a combined capacity of 960 megawatts, about enough electricity to power 770,000 homes in the US.
Image: X-energy via AmazonAmazon’s blog post today says that the Cascade facility should create about 100 permanent jobs, as well as more than 1,000 construction jobs.

title: NOAA Forecast Maps Reveal What’s in Store for Your State This Winter
summary:
Under normal conditions in the Pacific, trade winds blow west along the equator, transporting warm water from South America to Asia.
El Niño and La Niña are two opposing climate patterns that disrupt these normal conditions, according to NOAA.
Under La Niña conditions, winter temperatures also tend to be above average in the south and below average in the north.
Periods of El Niño and La Niña typically last 9 to 12 months, but they can last years.
The CPC expects weak La Niña conditions to persist through the winter, then shift to ENSO-neutral conditions sometime between January and March 2026.

title: Jabra Enhance Select 700 Review: Still Great Hearing Aids
summary:
So what is it about the Enhance Select 700 aids that makes them 200 better than the Select 500?
The big sell is a new audio feature called SoundScape Auto Focus.
I struggled a bit with Auto Focus when I first started using the Enhance Select 700, as I had trouble hearing my wife in a restaurant playing loudish music over the PA—exactly the scenario Auto Focus was designed for.
The bottom line is that if you’re happy with your Enhance Select 500 (or 300), there is absolutely no need to rush to upgrade to the Select 700.
For that reason, the Jabra Enhance Select 300 remains my top pick for over-the-counter hearing aids, with the 700 making for a compelling product if price is no object.

title: Pokémon Legends: Z-A makes a big, welcome change for shiny hunters
summary:
Pokémon Legends: Z-A hadn’t been out even a few hours before the tweets started rolling in: Shiny pokémon don’t despawn.
In other Pokémon games, like Scarlet and Violet, pokémon despawn after you get a certain distance away from them or trigger a loading screen.
You can still miss out on shiny pokémon in Z-A, but we’ll get to that in a bit.
Fleeing pokémon aside, the new shiny spawning mechanics are great for a game so heavy on roundabout, vertical, on-foot exploration.
It’s a relief knowing that most shiny pokémon will be waiting for you to reach them on your own terms.

title: How ‘Wood Vaulting’ Could Help Slow Climate Change
summary:
How Wood Vaulting WorksThe concept is straightforward: instead of constructing massive machines to collect atmospheric carbon dioxide and inject it miles into the Earth’s crust, wood vaulters simply divert materials from Earth’s fast-paced biological carbon cycle into the much-slower geological carbon cycle.
As they await the axe, trees in logging-focused forests take up roughly 170 billion tons of carbon every year, 14 billion tons of which finds its way into wood.
Another start-up, Mast Reforestation, has buried burned trees on a plot of private land in Montana.
Clay’s fine-grained structure ensures that little to no oxygen reaches buried wood, preventing bacteria from decomposing it.
Construction of the first trench of the world’s first commercial-scale wood vault, near the Potomac River, where the equivalent of 100 metric tons of carbon dioxide were buried.
